item.title: Promising Future Yield Responses With Virtual Agronomist in Zambia
item.description: Maize is a staple food for over half of the Zambian population and is cultivated by around eighty percent of smallholder farmers in the country. However, despite this, maize yield per hectare has often been significantly low, with farmers only averaging around 1.5 tonnes per hectare. Contributing factors to this low yield include drought brought about by climate change, pests and diseases, nutrient-deficient soils, and suboptimal agronomic practices. During our pilot programmes in the 2023/2024 season, iSDA partnered with IAPRI (Indaba Agricultural Policy Research Institute) to deliver tailored fertiliser recommendations to farmers in Zambia with an objective to increase maize yield by half and raise awareness of soil fertility levels across smallholder farms in the districts of Monze and Kapiri Mposhi.

item.title: Three Times More Yield for Tanzanian Farmers With Virtual Agronomist
item.description: At iSDA, we have been seeing fantastic positive yield responses with Virtual Agronomist across a range of crops and countries, including maize in Côte D’Ivoire, barley and sorghum in Uganda, coffee in Kenya and rice in Zambia. One of the most notable responses comes from sunflower and rice farmers in Tanzania whose crops are showing impressive yield results and offering positive predictions in growth and profit. In 2022 we started a pilot programme in Tanzania with sunflower farmers in Singida, Iringa, Manyara and Dodoma with Pyxus International.

item.title: iSDAsoil used in malaria mapping study
item.description: iSDA’s soil and agronomy map iSDAsoil was recently used by scientists to create a framework to map the malaria exposure levels of Africans living in towns and cities. Though iSDAsoil is primarily used by iSDA as input for Virtual Agronomist, which determines the best use and combinations of fertilisers on their land, it also contains information on different chemical and physical soil properties that were used by these scientists. Soil pH has an effect on the habitats of the Anopheles mosquito which transmits malaria.

item.title: Sustain Africa - increasing access to affordable fertiliser at scale
item.description: As fertiliser prices continued to spike due to the Russia/Ukraine conflict, iSDA joined the Sustain Africa initiative in 2022 to increase African farmers’ access to affordable fertiliser. The initiative is a partnership between multiple organisations including the International Fertilizer Association, Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, African Fertilizer, Agribusiness Partnership (AFAP) and AGRA. It has already targeted 1.5 million farmers across the continent. A great challenge when it comes to fertiliser use in Africa is the lack of precision in delivering the correct chemical formulation needed for each patch of farmland.

item.title: CEO Announcement
item.description: On behalf of the iSDA Board and team, I am delighted to announce Jamie Collinson as our new Chief Executive Officer. Jamie has been instrumental to iSDA’s development since joining as Chief Technology Officer in 2020. His appointment to CEO reflects our firm belief, demonstrated over iSDA’s initial discovery phase, that a technology and science-driven approach will unlock agricultural productivity across the African continent. Jamie is a world-class technologist, and has a demonstrated track record of growing early stage businesses to success.

item.title: iSDA releases a large soil analysis dataset for Africa
item.description: ISDA is proud to release a large dataset of analysed soil samples covering the African continent. These data are analysis-ready and do not require any preprocessing before usage. The dataset was collected and analysed according to protocols created by the African Soil Information Service (AfSIS) project (Vågen T-G et al., 2010). AfSIS was an initiative funded by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, aimed at improving soil information across Africa. Data were collected and analysed between 2008 and 2020.

item.title: Launch of Global Crop Nutrient Databases
item.description: On 6th September 2022 a landmark new open data crop nutrition platform will launch. A partnership of the Consortium for Precision Crop Nutrition, global research institutes and agtech companies like iSDA, the first outputs will be two databases focused on crop nutrition. The databases will serve as a valuable open resource for agriculturual researchers and those in industry conducting field trials on soil fertility and crop nutrition. Users can both contribute to and benefit from the shared datasets, allowing critical data to be shared amongst researchers and commercial companies.

item.title: iSDA exhibiting at AGRF Summit, Kigali
item.description: Grow. Nourish. Reward - Bold Actions for Resilient Food Systems AGRF, Africa’s premier forum for driving the food and agriculture agenda in the continent, will host its 12th annual summit under the theme Grow. Nourish. Reward – Bold Actions for Resilient Food Systems from September 5-9, 2022 in Kigali, Rwanda. We’ll be attending and exhibiting our products: Virtual Agronomist Directly supporting the aims of the summit is Virtual Agronomist, our system for expert advisory for farmers at scale, which supports resilient food systems by improving smallholder farmer yields and incomes, and by reducing waste through individualised fertiliser plans.

item.title: World Congress of Soil Science 2022
item.description: Keith Shepherd (iSDA Chief Science Officer) presented a paper at the World Congress of Soil Science on A Global Soil Spectral Calibration & Estimation Service in Glasgow in August 2022. The paper described ia freely available service that will allow users anywhere in the world to upload soil infrared spectra measurements and obtain estimates of multiple soil properties. The presentation can be viewed here.

item.title: iSDA introduces the Virtual Agronomist App to the International Fertilizer Association
item.description: On 26th February 2021 the iSDA team demonstrated the prototype app “Virtual Agronomist” to the International Fertilizer Association (IFA). The recorded webinar is available to view on YouTube. Presenting and answering the many user questions were members of the iSDA team: Jonathan Crouch, CEO; Jamie Collinson, CTO; Monica Cross, Head of Operations; Matt Miller, Lead Data Scientist; and Keith Shepherd, Head of Diagnostics and Decision Science. The webinar was chaired by Achim Dobermann, Chief Scientist at IFA.

item.title: AfCPA Conference
item.description: Notes from the first African Conference on Precision Agriculture, 8th to 10th December 2020. The session was hosted by Jonathan Crouch (CEO, iSDA) with contributions from Matt Miller (Lead Data Scientist, iSDA), Jamie Collinson (CTO, iSDA), and Keith Shepherd (Head of Diagnostics and Decision Science, iSDA). The Panel comprised Praveen Singh (Agronomist, Indorama), Pieter Pypers (Senior Agronomist, International Institute of Tropical Agriculture), and Rik van den Bosch (Director, International Soil Reference and Information Centre).

item.title: University of Aberdeen’s research project to tackle land loss in Ethiopia, utilises iSDAsoil
item.description: David McBey and Michael Martin from the University of Aberdeen speak to iSDA about how they are using the iSDAsoil resource to underpin the tools developed for their project. The project – Reducing land degradation and carbon loss from Ethiopia’s soils to strengthen livelihoods and resilience – is funded through a £1,000,000 grant from the UKRI Global Challenges Research Fund (GCRF). David McBey describes the project aims and background My background is that I’m a social scientist.

item.title: ASA Conference
item.description: Notes from the Special symposium on Translating Visionary Science for Excellence in African Agronomy at The American Society of Agronomy (ASA), the Crop Science Society of America (CSSA), and the Soil Science Society of America (SSSA) International Annual Meeting. 10th to 11th November 2020. Chief Scientist, International Fertiliser Association.

item.title: iSDAsoil Launch
item.description: iSDAsoil previously launched on 23rd October 2020 and is an open access soil property map with 30m resolution for Africa. iSDA has collaborated with ICRAF, Rothamsted Research, Envirometrix, GiLab, and MultiOne to gather the immense dataset which underpins this work. Using on-site soil samples and computer modelling, a detailed and interactive image is produced displaying multiple properties of the soil throughout Africa. The high resolution of the data (24 billion data points) means that a single farm can identify the soil type accurate to a particular field.

item.title: International Fertilizer Association Webinar 26 February 2021
item.description: An information revolution in Africa? Introducing iSDAsoil 26 February 2021, 3pm to 4pm CET IFA, the International Fertilizer Association is holding a free webinar focusing on iSDAsoil. IFA’s Members include fertilizer producers, traders and distributors, as well as their associations, service providers to the industry, research organizations, and non-governmental organizations (NGOs). Join us for a live demonstration of iSDAsoil with the team, and a discussion with IFA Chief Scientist Achim Dobermann on what this mapping can mean for the future of farming in Africa.

item.title: iSDAsoil at the AfCPA Virtual Conference
item.description: To celebrate the launch of iSDAsoil, the iSDA team made two presentations at The 1st African Conference on Precision Agriculture (AfCPA) in December 2020. An introduction to iSDAsoil Jonathan Crouch, CEO of iSDA presented an overview of iSDAsoil. He outlined the history of digital soil mapping in Africa, the improvements made in iSDAsoil, and some applications of the resource: The iSDAsoil interactive workshop The iSDA team then held an in-depth interactive session on iSDAsoil.

item.title: iSDAsoil at the ASA-CSSA-SSSA Virtual Conference
item.description: To celebrate the launch of iSDAsoil, the iSDA team made two presentations at The American Society of Agronomy, the Crop Science Society of America, and the Soil Science Society of America (ASA-CSSA-SSSA) Conference. This international virtual conference ran from the 9-13 November 2020. Achim Dobermann of the iSDA Board presented an overview of iSDAsoil. He outlined the problem space, importance of the breakthrough, and its potential applications: Achim Dobermann presents iSDAsoil
